abstract: The company has scheduled a news conference for Friday to address the controversy.
snippet: The company has scheduled a news conference for Friday to address the controversy.
lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO  As Apple prepared to address the mounting controversy surrounding the antenna of the iPhone 4, one thing appeared clear: the company does not plan to recall the popular device.

headline.main: Apple Is Not Expected to Recall Troubled iPhone
headline.print_headline: Apple Is Not Expected To Recall Troubled iPhone

abstract: Updates from Apple’s headquarters on what it has to say about problems with the antenna in the iPhone 4.
snippet: Updates from Apple’s headquarters on what it has to say about problems with the antenna in the iPhone 4.
lead_paragraph: John Markoff and I were at Apple’s headquarters in Cupertino, Calif., on Friday for the company’s press conference about the iPhone 4. There has been persistent criticism of the phone’s antenna design and wireless reception. A case or “bumper” can alleviate the problem, and Apple said it would offer free cases to iPhone 4 buyers. Our live updates from the event are below.

headline.main: Updates From Apple’s Discussion of iPhone 4 Problem

abstract: Steven P. Jobs acknowledged some problems with the iPhone 4’s antenna, but said they had been widely exaggerated.
snippet: Steven P. Jobs acknowledged some problems with the iPhone 4’s antenna, but said they had been widely exaggerated.
lead_paragraph: CUPERTINO, Calif.  Many expected a mea culpa from Steven P. Jobs, Apple’s chief executive. Instead, he turned the iPhone 4’s antenna problems into a marketing event on Friday.

abstract: A tour of one of Apple’s “black labs” proved Apple is serious about antenna design, but it shed no new light on the problem.
snippet: A tour of one of Apple’s “black labs” proved Apple is serious about antenna design, but it shed no new light on the problem.
lead_paragraph: In the wake of a hastily called news conference to defend its popular iPhone 4 smartphone this morning, Apple invited 11 reporters (including me) to visit one of its wireless testing labs.

headline.main: A Field Trip to an Apple Lab
